p: From 2010 to 2017, DRDs increased from 337 to 1,184, totaling 4,546 over that period. 73.7% (3,352/4,546) of DRDs had an assigned T-code specifying at least one drug, and 61.3% of these had more than one drug recorded. Since 2010, the proportion of DRDs attributed solely to synthetic opioids such as fentanyl has increased in our cohort from 2.1% in 2010 to 69.6% in 2017 ( FigureÂ 3 ). In 2017, synthetic opioids were co-involved in 93.3% of all opioid-related deaths, 68.9% of prescription opioid deaths, 88.5% of heroin-related deaths, 79.1% of cocaine-related deaths, and 85.8% of deaths involving psychostimulants. Results stratified by HCV status are included in Supplemental Table S4.
